actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration, Refugees, and International Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Immigration, Refugees, and International Law

official_title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to permit aliens who have served in the Armed Forces for at least 4 years after enlistment abroad to enter the United States for permanent residence as special immigrants.

summary.text: Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to grant special immigrant status to an alien service member or veteran who has served honorably in the U.S. armed forces for four years and to any accompanying spouse and children.

titles.title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to permit aliens who have served in the Armed Forces for at least 4 years after enlistment abroad to enter the United States for permanent residence as special immigrants.
